common_issues.title: Pieces OS and application performance issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS not running after multiple attempts and reinstallation on Windows.  Additionally, the desktop application is slow, laggy, and unresponsive, especially after the latest update.  LLMs are also not providing complete or correct code. Troubleshooting may include checking system compatibility, reinstalling/updating software, and verifying LLM usage.

common_issues.title: Copilot struggles to access and utilize workstream activities
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot failing to locate or interact correctly with workstream activities, especially when generating daily work reports or refreshing past activities.  Issues include time range selection being ignored and inability to access multiple activities simultaneously.  While single activity access via the 'start copilot chat' button may function, the core functionality of utilizing workstream data seems impaired.  This affects macOS users on Pieces OS version 4.2.1.

related_issues.title: Copilot doesn't use workstream activities properly.(It can't find data)
related_issues.text:
Copilot doesn't use workstream activities properly.(It can't find data)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Last week, I used the copilot for creating report of the day's work logs.
It worked properly but I doesn't work since yesterday(I don't know the issue starts from yesterday but I detected it on yesterday)

Copliot can't find the activities in workstream and It doesn't care about time range selection.

It works when using 'start copilot chat' button in specific activity, but can't use with multiple activities.

I hope to use it for creating daily work report everyday.

- requested today's daily work report
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb4e4763-8866-432f-9ce5-12b4a0b4eead)
- requested today's daily work report using english
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e11a9ed2-2714-4f2b-8d6b-c3272dccafbd)
- showing that I have acitivities
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c27034e-0640-45b5-8da8-83e715b95e5e)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces app on Windows crashes/slows, OS fails to start
common_issues.description: Multiple users report Pieces for Windows crashing when moving between screens or scrolling, especially with version 12.  Others report extreme slowness/unresponsiveness.  Additionally, Pieces OS fails to launch for some users even after reinstallation.  Issue appears across different Pieces versions (10.0.1, 12.0.0).

related_issues.title: Crash when scrolling or moving a window to another screen

Crash when scrolling or moving a window to another screen

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I don't know how to provide more info.
Every time I move the app on my left screen, it crashes. Oftentimes when I scroll the chats list or the chat itself, it crashes, too.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Slow Performance and Unresponsiveness
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance and unresponsiveness in the Pieces desktop application and VS Code extension, especially after updates or sending multiple messages.  Symptoms include lag, delayed responses, and high CPU/RAM usage.  Some users experience complete application failure. Troubleshooting steps include hard reset of active runtime and reinstallation, but these have not been universally successful. An error related to the Gemini-pro model is also frequently reported.

related_issues.title: UI in Pieces OS for VS Code is extremely slow after sending several messages
related_issues.text:
UI in Pieces OS for VS Code is extremely slow after sending several messages
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After sending several messages to Pieces Copilot in the extension for VS Code, there is a significant performance drop to the program which leads to the app eventually becoming extremely slow and difficult to use when pressing buttons, using keyboard input, and the speed of which a LLM responds. CPU usage and RAM usage also spikes when this occurs.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Ollama Installation Failures Across Platforms
common_issues.description: Users are reporting failures installing Ollama and launching Pieces OS on Linux, Windows, and macOS.  Linux users encounter immediate "Ollama failed to install" errors. Windows and macOS users report Pieces OS failing to start or respond, especially after updates.  Potential solutions include checking system compatibility, reinstalling Pieces OS, and verifying network connectivity.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. ### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

it just won't open or respond after the latest tahoe beta update
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the 'Pieces OS and application performance issues', focusing on Windows compatibility, application responsiveness, and LLM accuracy.
Investigate and address the 'Copilot struggles to access and utilize workstream activities' issue on macOS, specifically the time range selection and multi-activity access.
Troubleshoot 'Pieces app on Windows crashes/slows, OS fails to start' by examining crash reports and optimizing performance for version 12.
Address the 'Pieces OS and Ollama Installation Failures Across Platforms' by providing clear installation instructions and verifying compatibility across operating systems.
Improve LLM code generation completeness and correctness based on feedback in ticket #716.
Optimize Pieces desktop application performance and responsiveness, especially after updates, and investigate the Gemini-pro model error.
Provide support and documentation for users experiencing login/authentication issues (ticket #759).
